findings.flow_node_component_structure: FlowNodeComponent in src/ui/node.rs is a Dioxus 0.7 component that renders workflow nodes. It accepts a Node struct prop which contains execution_state: ExecutionState field. The component already has a 'Status indicator' section (lines 101-146) that renders badges based on node.config.status values. The existing badge pattern uses: bg-{color}-500/15 for background, text-{color}-400 for text, border-{color}-500/30 for border, with rounded-full styling and h-2.5 w-2.5 icons.
available_icons: LoaderIcon (set_b.rs) - spinning loader for running state
HelpCircleIcon (set_c.rs) - question mark for unknown states
Plus icon_by_name registry entries: server, zap, webhook, clock, mail, globe, database, shuffle, code, sparkles, git-branch, git-fork, repeat, merge, message-square, send, file-output
findings.current_styling_approach: Tailwind CSS utility classes via class: attribute. Pattern for status badges: 'inline-flex items-center gap-1 rounded-full border px-1.5 py-px text-[9px] font-medium leading-none {bg_color} {text_color} {border_color}'. Category colors use opacity variants like 'border-emerald-500/40', 'bg-emerald-500/15 text-emerald-400'. The icon_by_name function accepts icon name string and class string, returning an Element.
findings.node_prop_access: Direct access via node.execution_state. The ExecutionState enum (src/graph/execution_state.rs) has 6 variants: Idle, Waiting, Running, Succeeded, Failed, Skipped. It implements Display (lowercase strings), is_terminal() returns true for Succeeded|Failed|Skipped, is_active() returns true for Running|Waiting. Default is Idle. JSON serialization uses lowercase.
animation_patterns: animate-spin - Tailwind built-in, used for LoaderIcon in running states
Custom keyframe 'dash' for connection line animation (main.rs line 272)
Custom keyframe 'slide-in-right' for panel animations (main.rs line 273-274)
transition-shadow duration-150 - smooth shadow transitions on hover/select
transition-all duration-150 - for handle hover effects
findings.recommended_approach: Extend the existing status indicator section in FlowNodeComponent to use node.execution_state instead of/in addition to node.config.status. Create a match expression on node.execution_state with AWS Step Functions style styling: Running=blue (bg-blue-500/15 text-blue-400 border-blue-500/30) with LoaderIcon animate-spin, Succeeded=green (bg-emerald-500/15 text-emerald-400 border-emerald-500/30) with CheckCircleIcon, Failed=red (bg-red-500/15 text-red-400 border-red-500/30) with XIcon, Skipped=dimmed (bg-slate-500/15 text-slate-400 border-slate-500/30) with XIcon opacity-50, Waiting=amber (bg-amber-500/15 text-amber-400 border-amber-500/30) with ClockIcon, Idle=none (render nothing). Reuse the existing badge pattern from lines 128-134. May need to add PauseIcon and RefreshIcon to the registry if not using icon_by_name fallback.
